abstract: Supreme Court justices will be working in shadow of Roe v Wade, 1973 ruling that established constitutional right to abortion, as they prepare to hear a pair of cases on same-sex marriage; even some supporters of abortion rights believe ruling on abortion went too far, too fast, lesson that opponents of same-sex marriage hope court will take to heart.
lead_paragraph: Even supporters of abortion rights believe the 1973 Supreme Court ruling went too far, too fast, a lesson opponents of same-sex marriage hope the court, hearing two cases, will take to heart.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Shadow of Roe v. Wade Looms Over Ruling on Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Shadow of Roe v. Wade Looms Over Ruling on Gay Marriage
headline.seo: Roe’s Shadow as Supreme Court Hears Same-Sex Marriage Cases

snippet: Even supporters of abortion rights believe the 1973 Supreme Court ruling went too far, too fast, a lesson opponents of same-sex marriage hope the court, hearing two cases, will take to heart....
